SEARCH
Package org.opengrok.indexer.analysis

Interface JFlexJointLexer

All Superinterfaces:
JFlexLexer, JFlexStackingLexer
All Known Implementing Classes:
AdaSymbolTokenizer, AdaXref, EiffelSymbolTokenizer, EiffelXref, HCLLexer, HCLSymbolTokenizer, HCLXref, JavaScriptLexer, JavaScriptSymbolTokenizer, JavaScriptXref, PerlSymbolTokenizer, PerlXref, PLSQLSymbolTokenizer, PLSQLXref, RLexer, RSymbolTokenizer, RubySymbolTokenizer, RubyXref, RXref, SQLSymbolTokenizer, SQLXref, TerraformSymbolTokenizer, TerraformXref, TypeScriptSymbolTokenizer, TypeScriptXref, VerilogSymbolTokenizer, VerilogXref
public interface JFlexJointLexer extends JFlexStackingLexer
Represents an API for JFlex lexers that produce multiple types of derived OpenGrok documents (e.g., cross-reference documents [xrefs] or Lucene search documents [tokenizers]) from the same JFlex productions.

  • Method Details

    • offer

      void offer(String value) throws IOException
      Passes non-symbolic fragment for processing.
      Parameters:
      value - the excised fragment
      Throws:
      IOException - if an error occurs while accepting

    • offerSymbol

      boolean offerSymbol(String value, int captureOffset, boolean ignoreKwd) throws IOException
      Passes a text fragment that is syntactically a symbol for processing.
      Parameters:
      value - the excised symbol
      captureOffset - the offset from yychar where value began
      ignoreKwd - a value indicating whether keywords should be ignored
      Returns:
      true if the value was not in keywords or if the ignoreKwd was true
      Throws:
      IOException - if an error occurs while accepting

    • skipSymbol

      void skipSymbol()
      Indicates that something unusual happened where normally a symbol would have been offered.

    • offerKeyword

      void offerKeyword(String value) throws IOException
      Passes a text fragment that is syntactically a keyword symbol for processing.
      Parameters:
      value - the excised symbol
      Throws:
      IOException - if an error occurs while accepting

    • startNewLine

      void startNewLine() throws IOException
      Indicates that the current line is ended.
      Throws:
      IOException - if an error occurs when handling the EOL

    • disjointSpan

      void disjointSpan(String className) throws IOException
      Indicates the closing of an open tag and the opening -- if className is non-null -- of a new one.
      Parameters:
      className - the class name for the new tag or null just to close an open tag.
      Throws:
      IOException - if an output error occurs

    • phLOC

      void phLOC()
      Indicates that eligible source code was encountered for physical lines-of-code count (physical LOC).
